txt.en: Using poisons and clinging webs, the weaver can manipulate and control her prey.

Oddly, spiders tend to use Sindarin to derive their names, perhaps because most of them receive their names from their foes. Most of them seen are also female.\n\nCommon feminine name endings in Sindarin are -anor, -dal, -dis, -el, -eth, -iel, -il, -gil, -los, -raen, -reth, -riel, -rian, -rien, -uilas, -uilos, -wen, and -wing. Common prefixes are Adan-, And-, Ar-, Bel-, Breg-, Celeb-, Dol-, Edhel-, El-, Fan-, Find-, Galadh-, Gil-, Hir-, Ior-, Ir-, Lal-, Mel-, Mor-, Nim-, Rod-, Sael-, and Tinu-.
